00002  * \file LocalCartesian.hpp

00010 #if !defined(GEOGRAPHICLIB_LOCALCARTESIAN_HPP)
00011 #define GEOGRAPHICLIB_LOCALCARTESIAN_HPP "$Id: LocalCartesian.hpp 6867 2010-09-11 13:04:26Z karney $"
00012 
00013 #include "GeographicLib/Geocentric.hpp"
00014 #include "GeographicLib/Constants.hpp"
00015 
00016 namespace GeographicLib {
00017 
00018   /**
00019    * \brief Local Cartesian coordinates
00020    *
00021    * Convert between geodetic coordinates latitude = \e lat, longitude = \e
00022    * lon, height = \e h (measured vertically from the surface of the ellipsoid)
00023    * to local cartesian coordinates (\e x, \e y, \e z).  The origin of local
00024    * cartesian coordinate system is at \e lat = \e lat0, \e lon = \e lon0, \e h
00025    * = \e h0. The \e z axis is normal to the ellipsoid; the \e y axis points
00026    * due north.  The plane \e z = - \e h0 is tangent to the ellipsoid.
00027    *
00028    * The conversions all take place via geocentric coordinates using a
00029    * Geocentric object (by default Geocentric::WGS84).
00030    **********************************************************************/
00031 
00032   class LocalCartesian {
00033   private:
00034     typedef Math::real real;
00035     const Geocentric _earth;
00036     real _lat0, _lon0, _h0;
00037     real _x0, _y0, _z0,
00038       _rxx, _rxy, _rxz,
00039       _ryx, _ryy, _ryz,
00040       _rzx, _rzy, _rzz;
00041   public:
00042 
00043     /**
00044      * Constructor setting the origin.
00045      *
00046      * @param[in] lat0 latitude at origin (degrees).
00047      * @param[in] lon0 longitude at origin (degrees).
00048      * @param[in] h0 height above ellipsoid at origin (meters); default 0.
00049      * @param[in] earth Geocentric object for the transformation; default
00050      *   Geocentric::WGS84.
00051      **********************************************************************/
00052     LocalCartesian(real lat0, real lon0, real h0 = 0,
00053                    const Geocentric& earth = Geocentric::WGS84) throw()
00054       : _earth(earth)
00055     { Reset(lat0, lon0, h0); }
00056 
00057     /**
00058      * Default constructor.
00059      *
00060      * @param[in] earth Geocentric object for the transformation; default
00061      *   Geocentric::WGS84.
00062      *
00063      * Sets \e lat0 = 0, \e lon0 = 0, \e h0 = 0.
00064      **********************************************************************/
00065     explicit LocalCartesian(const Geocentric& earth = Geocentric::WGS84)
00066       throw()
00067       : _earth(earth)
00068     { Reset(real(0), real(0), real(0)); }
00069 
00070     /**
00071      * Reset the origin.
00072      *
00073      * @param[in] lat0 latitude at origin (degrees).
00074      * @param[in] lon0 longitude at origin (degrees).
00075      * @param[in] h0 height above ellipsoid at origin (meters); default 0.
00076      **********************************************************************/
00077     void Reset(real lat0, real lon0, real h0 = 0)
00078       throw();
00079 
00080     /**
00081      * Convert from geodetic to local cartesian coordinates.
00082      *
00083      * @param[in] lat latitude of point (degrees).
00084      * @param[in] lon longitude of point (degrees).
00085      * @param[in] h height of point above the ellipsoid (meters).
00086      * @param[out] x local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00087      * @param[out] y local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00088      * @param[out] z local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00089      *
00090      * \e lat should be in the range [-90, 90]; \e lon and \e lon0 should be in
00091      * the range [-180, 360].
00092      **********************************************************************/
00093     void Forward(real lat, real lon, real h, real& x, real& y, real& z)
00094       const throw();
00095 
00096     /**
00097      * Convert from local cartesian to geodetic to coordinates.
00098      *
00099      * @param[in] x local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00100      * @param[in] y local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00101      * @param[in] z local cartesian coordinate (meters).
00102      * @param[out] lat latitude of point (degrees).
00103      * @param[out] lon longitude of point (degrees).
00104      * @param[out] h height of point above the ellipsoid (meters).
00105      *
00106      * The value of \e lon returned is in the range [-180, 180).
00107      **********************************************************************/
00108     void Reverse(real x, real y, real z, real& lat, real& lon, real& h)
00109       const throw();
00110 
00111     /** \name Inspector functions
00112      **********************************************************************/
00113     ///@{
00114     /**
00115      * @return latitude of the origin (degrees).
00116      **********************************************************************/
00117     Math::real LatitudeOrigin() const throw() { return _lat0; }
00118 
00119     /**
00120      * @return longitude of the origin (degrees).
00121      **********************************************************************/
00122     Math::real LongitudeOrigin() const throw() { return _lon0; }
00123 
00124     /**
00125      * @return height of the origin (meters).
00126      **********************************************************************/
00127     Math::real HeightOrigin() const throw() { return _h0; }
00128 
00129     /**
00130      * @return \e a the equatorial radius of the ellipsoid (meters).  This is
00131      *   the value of \e a inherited from the Geocentric object used in the
00132      *   constructor.
00133      **********************************************************************/
00134     Math::real MajorRadius() const throw() { return _earth.MajorRadius(); }
00135 
00136     /**
00137      * @return \e r the inverse flattening of the ellipsoid.  This is the
00138      *   value of \e r inherited from the Geocentric object used in the
00139      *   constructor.  A value of 0 is returned for a sphere (infinite inverse
00140      *   flattening).
00141      **********************************************************************/
00142     Math::real InverseFlattening() const throw()
00143     { return _earth.InverseFlattening(); }
00144     ///@}
00145   };
00146 
00147 } // namespace GeographicLib
00148 
00149 #endif
